greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of nodes in the rooted tree with Matula-Goebel number 2^n - 1.
comment: Every positive integer has a unique q-factorization (encoded by A324924) into factors q(i) = prime(i)/i, i > 0. For example:
Then a(n) is one plus the number of factors (counted with multiplicity) in the q-factorization of 2^n - 1.
example: The rooted tree with Matula-Goebel number 2047 = 2^11 - 1 is (((o)(o))(ooo(o))), which has 12 nodes (o's plus brackets), so a(11) = 12.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, May 12 2019
